title: HR Support Request workflow
content:
This section describes the metaphases and subordinate phases in the life cycle of an HR Support Request.

The workflow relies on business rules. Rules repeat from one phase to another when the end user can make a change to a field affected by a business rule during that phase.

Metaphase: Classification

Example: a request is submitted for information about vacation entitlement. There is no parent cart request. The phase automatically transitions to Classify.

Phase Transition Description
Log Automatic

Log is the starting point for requests. The result of the phase is the successful creation of a request.

The phase automatically transitions to Classify when either of the following apply:

  • It has no parent cart request.
  • It's notdependent on the approval of its parent cart request.

The phase automatically transitions to Close when its parent cart request is denied.

Next phase: Classify, or Close
Log Manual

The agent can manually transition the request to Abandon if the request is no longer valid or relevant.

Next phase: Abandon
Classify Automatic

The phase automatically transitions to Process when it has been assigned to a person or group.

Next phase: Process
Classify Manual

The agent can manually transition the request to Abandon if the request is no longer valid or relevant.

Next phase: Abandon

Metaphase: Fulfillment

Example: a request is submitted for information about how to apply to join the employee stock purchase plan. After the agent provides the requested information, When the Solution and Completion code information is provided, the phase transitions to Close automatically.

Phase Transition Description
Process Automatic

The phase automatically transitions to Close when either of the following occur:

  • It's fulfilled by comments.
  • A solution is provided, and a completion code entered, and all tasks are completed or cancelled.

Next phase: Close

Metaphase: Done (End)

Phase Transition Description
Close None

The HR request has been completed.

Next phase: None
Abandon None

The HR request is no longer relevant or has been canceled.

Next phase: None
